{"step_by_step_thinking": "The facial skeleton consists of several bones, some of which are paired and some of which are unpaired. The nasal, lacrimal, and inferior nasal concha bones are all paired, meaning there is one on each side of the face. The vomer, however, is an unpaired bone. It is located in the midsagittal line, and it forms the posterior part of the nasal septum.", "answer_choice": "D. Vomer"}
